block.p: Mallory Anne Prestlien, a television producer, was married yesterday to Steven Donato Cangialosi, a sports anchor and reporter. The Rev. James Reynolds performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Child in Richmond Hill, Queens.
The couple work at New York 1, the cable television news service.

Mallory Anne Prestlien, a television producer, was married yesterday to Steven Donato Cangialosi, a sports anchor and reporter. The Rev. James Reynolds performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Holy Child in Richmond Hill, Queens.
The couple work at New York 1, the cable television news service.

Mrs. Cangialosi, 32, graduated from the University of Southern California. She is a daughter of Robert Ivers Prestlien of Yakima, Wash., and the late Marcia Henderson-Prestlien. The bride's father owns Bob Ivers & Associates, an advertising and public relations agency in Yakima. Her mother was an actress who played Wendy in the 1950 Broadway production of "Peter Pan."

Mr. Cangialosi, 31, graduated from New York University. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Victor Cangialosi of Richmond Hill. His father, who is retired, was a photographic technician at Authentic Color, formerly in New York. WEDDINGS
